handist.mpijunit

Class MpiApgasTestLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • handist.mpijunit.MpiApgasTestLauncher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    apgas.impl.Launcher

    public final class MpiApgasTestLauncher
extends Object
implements apgas.impl.Launcher
    Launcher class for tests that rely on a combination of MPI and APGAS for Java calls. This class sets up the MPI and APGAS runtime before launching the Junit tests on every rank (or place in APGAS terminology). To use this class over the default MpiTestLauncher to run your tests, you need to specify this class in the MpiConfig annotation of your test class.
    Author:
    Patrick Finnerty

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
        Main method of the MpiApgasTestLauncher class.

        Sets up the APGAS environment using MPI. Rank 0 of the processes will launch the main method of the class specified as parameter with the arguments specified afterward.

        This main method takes at least one argument, the fully qualified name of the class whose main method is to be run. Arguments for that class' main need to to follow that first argument.

        Parameters:
        args - first argument is the fully qualified name of the class whose tests are to launch, the second argument is the path under which the Notifications sent to Junit are to be written.
        Throws:
        Exception - if an MPI exception occur

      • healthy

        public boolean healthy()
        Checks that all the processes launched are healthy.

        Current implementation of MpiApgasTestLauncher always returns true.

        Specified by:
        healthy in interface apgas.impl.Launcher
        Returns:
        true if all subprocesses are healthy

      • launch

        public void launch(int n,
                   List<String> command,
                   List<String> hosts,
                   boolean verbose)
            throws Exception
        Launches n processes with the given command line and host list. The first host of the list is skipped. If the list is incomplete, the last host is repeated.

        In this particular launcher implementation, this method is used by rank 0 to broadcast setup information to every other process which are expecting it in the slave() method.

        Specified by:
        launch in interface apgas.impl.Launcher
        Parameters:
        n - number of processes to launch
        command - command line
        hosts - host list (not null, not empty, but possibly incomplete)
        verbose - dumps the executed commands to stderr
        Throws:
        Exception - if launching fails

      • launch

        public Process launch(List<String> command,
                      String host,
                      boolean verbose)
               throws Exception
        Launches one process with the given command line at the specified host.

        Should not be called in practice as every java processes are supposed to be launched using the `mpirun` command. Implementation will print an "Internal error" on the System.err before calling for the program's termination and exiting with return code -1.

        Specified by:
        launch in interface apgas.impl.Launcher
        Parameters:
        command - command line
        host - host
        verbose - dumps the executed commands to stderr
        Returns:
        the process object
        Throws:
        Exception - if launching fails

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the local process launched using MPI.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface apgas.impl.Launcher
